How is CBG (cannabigerol) Made?

Cannabigerol (CBG) s present in low levels (usually less than 1%) in most cannabis strains, CBG is considered a minor cannabinoid. Cannabis plants produce cannabigerolic acid (CBGA), the precursor to the three main cannabinoid lines: tetrahydrocannabinolic acid (THCA), cannabidiolic acid (CBDA), and cannabichromenic acid (CBCA).

CBG's Potential Benefits.

The human body’s built-in endocannabinoid system (ECS) works to keep the body in its balanced state of homeostasis. While there are specific details about how cannabinoids work, in general the endocannabinoid system performs different functions specific to each area of the body.

What is CBG:

Cannabigerol is one of more than 120 identified cannabinoid compounds found in the plant genus Cannabis. Cannabigerol is the decarboxylated form of cannabigerolic acid, the parent molecule from which other cannabinoids are synthesized. Cannabigerol is a minor constituent of cannabis.

FULL SPECTRUM
VS BROAD SPECTRUM

Similar to the full spectrum entourage effect, our Superior Broad Spectrum CBD formula also offers a whole-body experience – just minus any THC. And like full spectrum CBD, our specialized Superior Broad Spectrum retains all of the helpful cannabinoids from its extraction, including terpenes and flavonoids; but it removes any trace amounts of THC, allowing the entourage effect without any additional worries or risks. Whether you decide to use our Superior Broad Spectrum formula or our other brand-new full spectrum CBD oil will depend on your personal preference. Each one has its benefits depending on why you’re using it. Both of them offer a whole-plant impact, which is far more significant than CBD isolate; however, our full spectrum CBD includes minimal THC content, while our Superior Broad Spectrum is THC-free.* To learn even more about the differences, check out our in-depth analysis, “The Difference Between Full Spectrum and Broad Spectrum CBD.”

Frequently Asked Questions

Everyone's body is different. As a result, the time it takes for CBD oil tinctures to work will vary for each person. Some may notice a difference soon after initial use, while others may take longer. We suggest giving yourself at least 30 days of daily use with CBD oil drops to determine how your body responds.

Simply unscrew the cap, fill the dropper (dropper will only fill about halfway, indicating one serving), and place the CBD oil drops under your tongue and swallow. Make sure to always shake the tincture bottle well before each use, then take one or two servings either in the morning or at night. Allow for 30 days of continued use to experience the best results and adjust as needed.

All of our products are THC-free.* This means that there is no THC detectable by current validated scientific analytical tools. All of our products undergo thorough testing at independent, third-party labs that are ISO-certified with a Certificate of Analysis (CoA) posted online for every batch.

Our suppliers craft their products to remove THC while always preserving CBD, additional cannabinoids (CBG and CBN), and terpenes for a superior plant profile.

CBD oil is a product containing just CBD – no additional cannabinoids, terpenes, etc. Hemp oil, on the other hand, is a variable term that is often used to describe products without consistency. Hemp oil is a very broad term that may result in broad-spectrum, full-spectrum, or isolate products.

Everyone has a unique shape, and size. The best number of CBD oil drops to take will vary for each person. Start with a small amount and slowly increase with each use until you know the right number of drops for you. We recommend taking one or two servings per day and allowing up to 30 days of daily use to know how your body responds.
